What is the significance of the Law of S: The Law of Surprise, an ancient custom, plays a crucial role in Ciris narrative. It requires a saved person to offer an unknown boon to their savior, frequently the firstborn child unknown to the father. Geralt invoked this law on Duny and Pavetta, Ciris parents, making Ciri his ward. He invoked the law again on a saved merchant, reinforcing the destined bond between Geralt and Ciri.
What is Ciri's full name and what is her: Cirilla Fiona Elen Riannon, known as Ciri, is the sole princess of Cintra, born in 1252 or 1253. She is the daughter of Pavetta and Emhyr var Emreis, also known as Duny, and the granddaughter of Queen Calanthe. Her titles include Queen of Cintra, Princess of Brugge, Duchess of Sodden, Heiress to Inis Ard Skellig and Inis An Skellig, and suzeraine of Attre and Abb Yarra.
During which holiday was Ciri most likel: Cirilla Fiona Elen Riannon, commonly known as Ciri, was presumably born during the Belleteyn holiday. Her birth year is believed to be 1252 or 1253. She is the sole princess of Cintra, the offspring of Pavetta and Emhyr var Emreis (alias Duny), and Queen Calanthes granddaughter.
